column4: how can I find the executable for VMWare workstation? for some reason my menu is pointing to "/usr/bin/vmwareesd" which doesn't exist, and "locate vmware" returns too many results to sift through
I guess it would make sense to try that wouldn't it...that's it :P
in the future though, is there a good way to search for any executable file i might be looking for?
for things like progs installed to non-standard locations
On, but that won't handle non-standard locations, sorry.
You really will have to use locate for that.
darn. oh well, a new command is always useful though :D
how about this: How can I edit my menu icon so it will launch vmware, and not vmwareesd?
If you can find it, then chances are you can edit it with a text editor.
Other alternative: right-click on it, then add it to panel. You can then right-click the icon in your panel to edit it.
Edits to your panel item don't affect what's launched from the menu, however.
yeah, then that wouldn't really help
Then locate your vmware-workstation.desktop and edit it by hand.
but i edited it with a text editor, all is well :D
